CHAPTER 6-3
PEDDLERS  AND  VENDORS
6-3-1
DEFINITIONS
Farmer's Market:  An outdoor market where at least 75% of products sold directly to
consumers is local food and agriculturally related products grown or created by canning,
baking, preserving, etc.
Peddler: as used in this chapter shall mean any person traveling from place to place, from
house to house to from street to street for the purpose of selling or soliciting for sale good,
wares, merchandise or services, other than agricultural products produced or processed in this
state; and shall also include any person transacting a temporary business within the City at
an established place of business.
Residential Route Sales Person: as used in this chapter shall mean any person who travels
from place to place, from house to house, or from street to street for the purpose of selling
or soliciting for sale goods, wares, merchandise or services, but who makes stop for sales or
delivery routinely, as part of a usual or regular route, and/or by invitation of the resident(s)
of the premises visited.
Sidewalk Vendor: as used in this chapter shall mean any person selling or soliciting for sale
goods, wares, merchandise or services, from a stationary but temporary or seasonal location,
on private or public property with the City of Brandon.

6-3-2 
EXCEPTIONS TO THIS CHAPTER
Except for Section 6-3-6 herein, the provisions of this chapter shall not apply to
solicitations, sales or distributions made (1) by charitable, educational/school sponsored,
religious or nonprofit organizations or other nonprofit organization; or (2) in connection
with any City or Brandon Chamber of Commerce sponsored event.   Each such exempt
person or organization shall register each sales project with City Hall Administrative
Staff or the Police Department on forms provided by that office. There shall be no fee for
such registration.

6-3-3
REFUSING TO LEAVE
Any peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor who enters upon premises owned or
leased by another and refuses to leave said premises after having been notified by the owner
or possessor of said premises, or his agent, to leave the same shall be deemed guilty of a
violation of the ordinance.

6-3-4
ENTRANCE TO PREMISES RESTRICTED
It shall be unlawful for any peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor to enter upon any
private premises when the same are posted with a sign stating "No Peddlers Allowed".

6-3-5
MISREPRESENTATION
It shall be unlawful for any peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor to make false or
fraudulent statements concerning the quality or nature of his goods, wares, merchandise or
services for the purpose of inducing another to purchase the same.

6-3-6
HOURS OF OPERATION
It shall be unlawful for any peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor to engage in the
business of peddling, selling or vending  between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and  9:00 a.m. the
following morning.  Peddling, selling or vending may be allowed on Sundays between the
hours of 1:00 p.m and 6:00 p.m. when specified on an approved application.  It shall be
unlawful for any peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor to engage in the business of
peddling on the following days:
New Year's Day,.....................  
January 1
President's Day,.......................  
Third Monday in February
Memorial Day,........................

Last Monday in May
Independence Day,..................  
July 4
Labor Day,..............................  
First Monday in September
Native American Day,.............  
Second Monday in October
Thanksgiving Day,..................  
Fourth Thursday in November
Day after Thanksgiving Day,..
Fourth Friday in November
Christmas Eve,........................  
December 24
Christmas Day,.......................   
December 25
New Years Eve, ......................  
December 31
The City Council may, upon application by the peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk
vendor, grant a permit to operate for longer hours.  The Council shall consider the applicant’s
request for additional times of operation based upon the Council’s determination of the health
and welfare of the public including but not limited to such criteria as traffic safety, pedestrian
safety, location(s) of operation, suitability of days and times requested considering the
product to be sold, projected age of customers, etc.  If it is determined that a permit may be
granted for additional hours and/or Sundays the City shall issue one permit which specifies
the hours and days during which the peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor is

permitted to operate.

6-3-7  
PERMIT REQUIRED
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in business as a peddler, route salesperson,
or sidewalk vendor or to operate a Farmer's Market within this City without first obtaining
a permit to do so.

6-3-8  
APPLICATION FOR PEDDLER, ROUTE SALESPERSON OR
SIDEWALK VENDOR PERMIT
The application for a peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor permit required by
the provisions of this article shall:
(A)
Contain a statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of any
crime, misdemeanor or violation of any state or federal law or municipal
ordinance or Code; the nature of the offense; the punishment or penalty assessed
therefor, if previously convicted; and the place of conviction.
(B)
Whether the applicant, upon any sale or order, shall demand, accept or receive
payment, or deposit, of money in advance of final delivery.
(C)
The period of time the applicant wishes to engage in business within the City.
(D)
The local and permanent addresses of the applicant and other persons who will
be selling within the City limits of Brandon.
(E)
The local and permanent addresses and the name of the person, if any, that the
applicant represents.
(F)
)The kind of goods, wares, merchandise or services the applicant wishes to
engage in such business within the City.
(G)
The last five (5) cities or towns wherein the applicant has worked before coming
to this City.
(H)
The number of the applicants’s South Dakota state sales tax license.
(I)
Such other relevant information as the chief of police may require for the
investigation of the applicant.

6-3-8.1  
FARMER'S MARKET PERMIT
Operation of a Farmer's Market must be permitted by the City. A permit to operate a
Farmer's Market may only be issued to an individual owning property or operating a
business in a Central or General Business or Light or Heavy Industrial or Institutional
District. Operation of a Farmer's Market is limited to the hours of 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.
requires all temporary structures to be removed on the same day as operation of the

market, and requires compliance with all City and County Ordinances, and State Laws. A
permit is only valid for the calendar year in which the permit is issued. The operator of
the Farmer's Market, not City, is responsible and liable for those vendors involved and is

responsible to secure the contact information for the vendors and any sales tax
obligations. The application for a Farmer's Market permit shall include:  
A. The name, and address of the applicant;
B. The location at which the proposed Farmer's Market will be held;
C. The proposed hours and days of operation of the proposed Farmer's Market; and 
D. Such other relevant information as the Brandon City Administrator, Brandon Building
Official-Code Enforcement Officer, or Chief of Police may require.
Wine may be sold off-sale at a Farmer’s Market if (1) the vendor selling it has an off-sale
alcohol license issued by the City; and (2) if the Farmer’s Market is within one hundred
(100) yards of a school or church the vendor has provided to the City written consent
from the entity for the operation and the City Council through motion has authorized such
sales.  Other than up to a fifty milliliter (50 ml) sample of the wine, wine may not
otherwise be consumed at the Farmer’s Market.

6-3-9
FALSE INFORMATION
It shall be unlawful for any person to give any false or misleading information in connection
with his application for a permit required by this article.

6-3-10
FINGERPRINTS, PHOTOGRAPHS
At the request of the City Finance Officer, the applicant for a permit required by this chapter
shall submit to fingerprinting and photographing by the Brandon Police Department or City
Administrative Staff.

6-3-11 
FEE FOR PERMIT
The application fee for a permit required by the provisions of this article shall be
established by resolution of the City Council and may be amended by the Council from
time-to-time.  All such fees are due by cash, cashier’s check, or money order tendered at
the time of application.  The fee is not refundable, even if no permit is granted.

6-3-12 
PROCESSING APPLICATION
The Brandon City Administrative Staff and Police Department shall complete a review of
each application for a permit applied for under this article within 48 (forty-eight) hours of
completion of the application and payment of the application fee. Weekends and holidays
do not count as part of that 48-hour period.

6-3-13
ISSUANCE RESTRICTED
No peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor's permit shall be issued to a corporation,
partnership or other impersonal legal entity.  Each individual person engaging in the business
of peddling within the City shall be required to have a permit whether acting for himself or
as an agent or representative of another.

6-3-14
DISPLAY
Every peddler, route salesperson, or sidewalk vendor having a permit issued under the
provisions of this article and doing business within the City shall openly display his permit. 
Failure to do so shall be deemed a violation of this ordinance.
Legislative History:
Authority:

Ordinance No. 360, 3/11/05.
SDCL Ch. 9-34-1, 7, 8, 18
6-3-15
REVOCATION OF PERMIT
A permit issued under the provisions of this article may be revoked for the violation by the
permittee of any provision of this Code, state law or City ordinance.  Upon such revocation,
such permit shall immediately be surrendered to a law enforcement, and failure to do so shall
be a violation of this ordinance.

6-3-16
PERMIT EXPIRATION DATE
Any permits issued under the provisions of this ordinance will expire at 9:00 o’clock p.m.
on the date of expiration which is written on the permit.

6-3-17
PENALTY FOR VIOLATION
Violation of this ordinance is punishable by a fine or by imprisonment as established in 1-10-
1 of the Brandon Municipal Code.
